page.title: 07HALE COUNTY PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: THE MAIN PART OF OUR SCHOOL WAS BUILT 112 YEARS AGO IN 1873. IT HAS VERY HIGH WINDOWS SO THE VICTORIAN CHILDREN COULD NOT LOOK OUT, AND WE CAN'T EITHER. THE INFANT CLASSROOM, THE LIBRARY, THE OFFICE AND THE KITCHEN ARE IN THE OLD BUIDING. THE JUNIOR CLASSROOM IS MADE OF WOOD AND IT IS 20 YEARS OLD. CHILDREN COME TO HALE SCHOOL WHEN THEY ARE NEARLY FIVE AND STAY UNTIL THEY ARE ELEVEN. THEY GO UP TO THE JUNIORS WHEN THEY ARE SEVEN. AT THE MOMENT THERE ARE 20 INFANTS AND 31 JUNIORS. WE HAVE TWO TEACHERS AND ON FRIDAYS ANOTHER TEACHER COMES FOR THE DAY SO THAT THE HEAD CAN BE IN HER OFFICE. WE ALSO HAVE A SECRETARY, A COOK, A KITCHEN HELPER, TWO DINNER LADIES AND A CARETAKER. ALL THE CHILDREN STAY TO LUNCH. ABOUT HALF HAVE COOKED LUNCH AND AND THE REST BRING A PACKED LUNCH.
